article_node.title: The U.S. government may take a stake in Intel
article_node.summary: The U.S. government is in discussions about potentially taking a stake in struggling chipmaker Intel Corp. as part of a bailout strategy, although no decisions have been made regarding the terms or timing of such an investment. Intel has faced significant challenges, including layoffs and project cancellations, and is under scrutiny from President Trump, who has called for the resignation of CEO Lip-Bu Tan due to his ties with Chinese companies. Former Intel CEO Craig Barrett has suggested that Intel's customers should invest $40 billion in the company to ensure a stable supply of semiconductors, emphasizing the need for domestic manufacturing.
